page.title: 01Area around Hoxne Village
page.content: The area is predominantly arable, growing cereals, sugar beet and rape with intensive grazing on water meadows bordering the Rivers Waveney and Dove. Rsidential areas are Hoxne village,upper and lower Oakley Streets and a small Hamlet at Birlingford, plus scattered farmhouses and cotage. Most buildngs are of 16th & 18 century date, although some are earlier and there are some recent buidings (mostly brick and tile) Hoxne is a small but viable, active village (despite poor transport facilitis) still retaining essential services e.g school,doctor, village hall and a strong senes of community with a variety of clubs & social organisation. Some residents are employed locally in agriculture (including rape processing, intensive poultry) but most work in neighburing towns (Diss,Eye and Stradbroke)
